articles.title: Cargill Inc. delegation here
articles.content:
Cargill Inc. delegation here
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the 
Cargill Inc. of the United States led  by Norwell 
Coquillard, President for North Asia, arrived here Tuesday.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun praises S. Korean students' solidarity with workers
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun praises S. Korean students' solidarity with workers
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today says 
the south Korean students' joining in the workers' strikes 
for their vital rights and democracy is a very right action 
which is a sign of the south Korean people's escalating 
struggle against dictatorship and for democracy.
   In a commentary the daily says the whole nation praises 
and fully supports the students' solidarity struggle.
   The south Korean people including workers and students 
have the same desire for independence, democracy and 
reunification, it notes. Therefore, it is natural that they 
join each other in the struggle to realise their same 
desire.
   What the workers and students will lose in the struggle 
against Kim Young Sam and the fascist laws is the fetters of 
suppression and exploitation and what they will gain is 
genuine freedom, rights and life, it says, adding:
   The students under the South Korean Federation of 
University Student Councils will continue fighting for 
independence, democracy and reunification in solidarity with 
the workers and other people.

articles.title: Press conference called by Pyongyang mission of NDFSK
articles.content:
Press conference called by Pyongyang mission of NDFSK
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang mission of 
the National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) called 
a press conference on January 21 to explain information on 
the meeting of the standing committee of its central 
committee.
   The information on the meeting was distributed at the 
press conference.
   Chief of the mission Ri Jong Sang said that the vanguard 
fighters of the NDFSK and south Korean people more deeply 
felt the greatness of Secretary Kim Jong Il, who 
firmly defended justice of the world and socialism, saved 
the destinies of the nation and humankind, turned 
adversities into favourable conditions and thus brilliantly 
adorned the history of the era of independence last year.
   Last year was a historic one when it was recognised as 
the declaration of the times that the people's cause of 
independence, the cause of socialism is sure to win as it is 
guided by General Kim Jong Il, Ri Jong Sang said, adding:
   The south Korean people more deeply realized that only 
when they fight as indicated by the Juche idea, holding 
General Kim Jong Il in high esteem, will the sacred cause of 
independence, democracy and reunification certainly be 
achieved.
   The south Korean people, he further said, have the 
unchangeable faith that the great leader President 
Kim Il Sung is immortal in the hearts of the people and that 
only when they are faithful to the guidance of General 
Kim Jong Il will the victory and future be ensured.

articles.title: Continued struggle declared in s. Korea
articles.content:
Continued struggle declared in S. Korea
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The "Korean Confederation 
of Trade Unions" called a press conference at the Myongdong 
Cathedral on January 21, at which it accused the traitor Kim 
Young Sam of showing no willingness to solve the 
controversial issue and declared that it would go on a 
general strike on January 22, according to a radio report 
from Seoul.
   Kwon Yong Gil, chairman of the confederation, denounced  
the traitor Kim Young Sam for his utterances that the 
"labour law" and the "law on the agency for national 
security planning" were passed through "legal procedures".
    He declared that they would fight it out until the laws 
are abrogated.
   Some 2,800 professors of 62 universities in south Korea 
who had taken part in a signature campaign in protest 
against the amended "labour law" and the "law on the agency 
for national security planning" released a statement on 
January 21 in demand of the total nullification of the laws.
   The statement demanded that the "summit meeting of ruling 
and opposition parties agree on the total withdrawal of the 
"labour law" prohibiting the formation of more than two 
unions at one work site and allowing companies to lay off 
workers and of the "law on the agency for national 
security planning" repressing the freedom of ideology and 
expression.
   If this demand is not met, not only the ruling party but 
also the opposition political camp will be the targets of 
public denunciation, it declared.

articles.title: Letter to S. Korean literary men
articles.content:
Letter to s. Korean literary men
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of  
the General Federation of the Unions of Literature and Art 
of Korea sent a letter to the south Korean people of 
literature and art in connection with the south Korean 
fascist clique intensifying the suppression of the 
workers' massive struggle against the retrogressive revision 
of the "law on the agency for national security planning" 
and the "labour law", while trying to justify the crackdown.
   The letter says that the suppression of the workers the 
kim Young Sam group are escalating, linking their struggle 
with the north, is nothing but an anti-democratic, anti-
national crime to further fascistize south Korean society 
and force the slave labour on them by effectuating the evil 
laws revised in a terrible atmosphere of confrontation 
between the north and the south.
   The men of literature and art are pioneers in denouncing 
injustice and social evils and guides of justice and truth, 
it notes, expressing the expectation that they will pave a 
way of justice, a way of patriotism, togther with workers.

articles.title: Youth league discusses tasks of young people in forced march of socialism
articles.content:
Youth league discusses tasks of young people in forced march of socialism
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The 11th Plenary Meeting 
of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth 
League was held in Pyongyang on January 20 and 21.
   Discussed at  the meeting were tasks of youth league 
organizations to become victors in the forced march of 
socialism  and to invigorate education through publications 
among young people.
   It outlined concrete tasks facing all the organizations 
and officials of the youth league in carrying out their duty 
in the forced march of socialism under the slogan "let us 
all become victors in this year's 'arduous march'!"
   The meeting called for imbuing all organizations with the 
Red Flag Idea of the Workers' Party of Korea  and stressed 
that  the youth league organizations should strengthen 
ideological education among the young people to encourage 
them to become human bombs and rifles defending the leader. 
   It also noted that the youth league 
organizations should enhance their role and increase their 
the might as reserve combat units and detached force of  
Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   It called on the young people to bring about a great 
upsurge in the socialist economic construction.

articles.title: Morality and great man
articles.content:
Morality and great man
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Jong In Suk, director of 
a consultation office in south Korea, wrote an article 
titled "Morality and great man" in appreciation of the noble 
virtues of Secretary Kim Jong Il, the Seoul-
based radio voice of national salvation reported.
   The article read in part:
   South Korean society has turned into a barren land of 
morality. Distrust and hatred among people have reached the 
extremes and nobody knows when this society will collapse.
   Unlike this society, the northern society is full of 
human love and sound morality. All people in the north 
regard their leader as the father of the nation and loyalty 
to him as their highest moral obligation and remain 
intensely loyal to President Kim Il Sung and Secretary
Kim Jong Il.
   The people's loyalty to the leader is based on their 
unique view of morality. The north is a mysterious land 
where love for the country, comrades and neighbors is valued 
as the most beautiful morality and people devotedly work and 
even defy death for the sake of society, the collective and 
their comrades.
   What is the source of the morality based on human love?
   President Kim Il Sung was the father of true 
moral politics.
   Secretary Kim Jong Il, while assisting the 
President, put heart and soul into helping the people in the 
north, splendidly trained by the President, to have more 
beautiful moral traits.
   On the basis of the man-centred Juche idea, General
Kim Jong Il propounded a theory of morality that defends 
human values most resolutely and develops humanity into most 
powerful, beautiful and noble beings. He also has turned the 
north into a powerful nation in moral and political aspects.
   With his practical examples, he teaches humankind what 
human morality should be like.
   He regards loyalty to the leader as the highest form of 
morality. He has been loyal and dutiful to the President.
   He considers it his bounden duty to respect and put 
forward the forerunners who were faithful to the motherland 
and the people.
   His famous work "Respecting the Forerunners of the 
Revolution is a Noble Moral Obligation of Revolutionaries" 
is an outcome of his noble view of morality.
   The north has the leader Kim Jong Il, the 
incarnation of morality and loyalty, and its people are 
united not only ideologically but also morally. So, the 
north will certainly overcome all difficulties and create a 
bright history with redoubled vigor.

articles.title: NDFSK calls for burying "civilian-veiled" dictatorship
articles.content:
NDFSK calls for burying "civilian-veiled" dictatorship
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The central committee of 
the National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) in the 
present fighting slogans on Jan. 17 called upon the people 
from all walks of life in south Korea to more vigorously 
turn out in the all-people resistance for the withdrawal of 
the evil laws revised by the Kim Young Sam group and for 
burying the "civilian-veiled" dictatorship, the Seoul-based 
radio voice of national salvation reported.
   The slogans say that the stirring present situation 
calls for holding higher the flag of struggle to put an end 
to the intelligence terrorist politics, the fascist 
repressive rule and build a genuine society of democracy in 
order to secure the urgent rights of 23 million workers and 
their families to democracy and existence.    The slogans 
continue:
   Let us abolish the slave "labour laws" which kill 
workers and fatten businessmen.
   Democracy is suffocated and the people are slaughtered by 
the "law on the agency for national security planning". Let 
us abrogate the "law" through struggle.
   Let us smash strong-arm suppression with an overall 
general strike, defend the "Korean Confederation of Trade 
Unions" and give full play to strong fighting and organising 
power.
   If solidarity of workers and students is achieved, the 
"civilian-veiled" dictatorship will be ended, the slogans 
say, calling upon the one million students to join in the 
general strike of workers.
   The slogans call upon the peasants to overthrow the 
"civilian-veiled" regime killing them, shoulder to shoulder 
with workers and upon the teachers who are deprived of the 
right to unity to undauntedly turn out in the struggle to 
repeal the evil laws.
   They also call upon the intellectuals to hold high the 
candle light of the struggle burning the revised evil laws 
and upon the pressmen to denounce the crimes of the 
"civilian-veiled" dictatorship going against the will of the 
people, with pens of justice in their hands.
   They appeal to the religionists to give harsh penalties 
to judas, Kim Young Sam.
   The slogans call for burying the "civilian-veiled" 
dictatorship with the unity of all the people.

articles.title: NDFSK on celebrating April 15 and February 16
articles.content:
NDFSK on celebrating April 15 and February 16
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the Standing 
Committee of the Central Committee of the National 
Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) was held in Seoul on 
January 20.
   The first agenda item of the meeting was to grandly 
celebrate the 85th birth anniversary of the great leader 
President Kim Il Sung and the 55th birthday of the great 
leader Secretary Kim Jong Il as the greatest national holiday 
common to humankind.
   The meeting set the February 10-20 period and April 10-20 
period as celebration days.    
   It discussed and adopted a program of organisational and 
political activities to mark the holidays and authorized the 
NDFSK central committee to issue books which carry ideas and 
theories of the great leaders and the achievements made 
under their leadership and deep respect and loyalty of the 
people of all social standings for them and publish 
documents to commemorate April 15 and February 16.
   It decided to dispatch a congratulatory group of the 
NDFSK to Pyongyang on the occasion of April 15 and February 
16 to wholeheartedly pray for the immortality of the 
President and present a congratulatory message and a silk 
banner of the NDFSK central committee to Secretary
Kim Jong Il.
   The meeting discussed the second agenda item, the way of 
the national democratic movememnt for this year.
   The way is to hold fast to the principle of activating 
the struggle for independence against the United States and 
the movement for national reunification and concentrate all 
efforts on overthrowing the traitorous Kim Young Sam regime, 
a stumbling block to democracy and reunification, the 
meeting stressed.
   Noting that the overthrow of the Kim Young Sam regime is 
the demand of the present situation, the will of the people 
and the task of the national history, the meeting stressed 
the need to strengthen the forces of workers,peasants and 
students with the workers as the axis and  unite the 
dissidents and other people to vigorously turn out in the 
nationwide resistance.
   It expressed the belief that the south Korean people will 
make a new turning point in the struggle for independence, 
democracy and reunification, full of the conviction of 
certain victory and optimism in this significant year and 
decorate the history of the nation.

articles.title: Labour movement in S. Korea supported worldwide
articles.content:
Labour movement in s. Korea supported worldwide
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA)-- The struggle of south 
Korean workers was actively supported in different 
countries.
   The British Society for Independence Studies in a 
statement January 16 said that the south Korean authorities 
are clamouring about "threats from the north"  in an attempt 
to conceal the essence of their dependent economy.
   We call upon all the labour movement, the labour Party 
and democratic and reasonable people in britain to express 
full solidarity with the labour movement in south Korea, 
said the statement.
   Chitta Vishwath, Secretary General of the All-India Peace 
and  Solidarity Organisation, in a statement January 16 said 
that it is only too natural that south Korean workers have 
turned out in the struggle against the amended "labour laws" 
and "law on the agency for national security planning."
   He expressed the conviction that the south Korean workers 
would continue their struggle till their just demands are 
met.
   He urged the Kim Young Sam group to abrogate the "labour 
laws" and the "law on the agency for national security 
planning" at once and release the arrested  union leaders 
and democrats without delay.
   M.M. Verma, Director of the Indian Centre for U.N. 
Studies, said in a statement that reconciliation and 
cooperation on the Korean Peninsula are unthinkable as long 
as the "national security law" and the concrete wall remain 
in south Korea.
   He stressed that the Kim Young Sam group honestly confess 
their crimes against the nation and step down from "power".

articles.title: DPRK public org. on Japan's move to avoid postwar settlement
articles.content:
DPRK public org. on Japan's move to avoid postwar settlement
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the 
DPRK Committee for Investigation into Damage Caused by 
Japanese Imperialist Occupation of Korea issued a statement 
today denouncing Takami Eto, former General Director of the 
Management and Coordination Agency of Japan, for his recent 
remarks denying the past crimes of Japanese imperialism.
   The statement says:
   Some time ago, Takami Eto said Japanese imperialism's 
invasion and military occupation of Korea were made under a 
"treaty" and that they were little different from the 
"merger of a town and a village." He also expressed doubt 
over the recruitment of "comfort women for the army" written 
in Japanese middle school history textbooks that will be 
available from this spring.
   His remarks denying Japan's past crimes have caused a big 
stir in the international community.
   It is an undeniable historical fact that militarist Japan 
began aggression on Korea from more than a hundred years ago 
and militarily occupied Korea for 41 years when it committed 
all kinds of unethical crimes including massacre, drafting 
of "comfort women" and forced labor.
   Nonetheless, Takami Eto, a former member of the Japanese 
government and a dietman "elected" by the people, distorted 
this stark fact and justified the past crimes. We can hardly 
repress surging resentment.
   The government authorities of Japan describe Eto's 
remarks as a talk based on his "individual view of history" 
and "not binding on the government." If this is true, they 
should raise a serious issue over this incident and resume 
negotiation with the DPRK for postwar settlement.
   The double-dealing tactics of the Japanese government 
compels us to view the revival of militarism and the 
rightist development of society in Japan in combination with 
the present government's policy of avoiding postwar 
settlement.
   A spokesman of the DPRK Foreign Ministry already issued a 
statement on January 10, urging Japan to immediately come to 
the negotiation table with the DPRK with a sincere attitude 
for postwar settlement.
   Our demand is absolutely just and principled.
   In response to this, the Japanese government manipulates 
the mass media of Japan to raise unreasonable preconditions 
such as "four-way talks" and "inter-Korean dialogue" and 
describe time as immature for postwar settlement, which 
should have already been done. It also wirepulls a private 
fund to pay "compensation" to some former "comfort women" in 
secrecy in an attempt to bribe them and avoid state 
reparation.
   It is outrageous for the offender to talk about "time" 
concerning the repentance of his crimes before the victim.
   It is more than half a century since the end of world war 
II and humankind are on the threshold of the 21st century. 
However, the agitation for the revival of militarism is not 
restricted by law but overlooked and defended by the 
government only in Japan unlike other defeated nations. This 
draws due attention from the unbiased public opinion around 
the world.
   The Japanese government must discard its wrong attitude 
toward cognition of history and postwar settlement and meet 
our just demand without delay.

articles.title: FM greets mauritanian counterpart
articles.content:
FM greets mauritanian counterpart
   Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) - Foreign Minister Kim Yong 
Nam sent a message of greetings to Sidi Ould Khliva on his 
appointment as Mauritanian Minister of Foreign Affairs and 
Cooperation.
   Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between 
the two countries would favorably develop in the interests 
of the two peoples, the message wished him success in his 
new work.
